name: Dungeon Warfare
description: Dungeon Warfare is a challenging tower defense strategy game where you become a dungeon lord to defend your dungeons with deadliest of traps and insidious contraptions against greedy adventurers and wanna-be heroes.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Core 2 Duo Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Graphic Card with at least 256MB of VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 100 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 8 / 7 Processor: 2.4 GHz Quad Core 2.0 (or higher) Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Graphic Card with at least 512MB of VRAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 300 MB available space Sound Card: Yes

reviews.review_text: This is an extremely fun game. I found it challenging and intriguing, with loads of ways to complete levels, tons of strategies to employ, and the easiest level editor to use that I've ever seen.  The game takes tower defense to a new level, because not only do you have to kill enemies by shooting them or destroying them, you have a second method after playing the game for an hour or two, where you can shove enemies off ledges and insta-kill them, spring them, etc. It opens up whole new ways of destroying your foes.  If I had to classify this game with anything else, I'd put it on par with Orcs Must Die. Easily a 9/10 tower defense for me. And it has steam workshop, play it now! I bought it at full price, and if you see it on sale it's DEFINITELY worth the purchase!
Super fantastic. In league with Kingdom Rush as one of the best Tower Defense games out there. The ability to replay levels with different 'runes' makes replayability interesting.

This is actually, hands down, one of the best tower defense games I've ever played! Its just perfect, honestly. I know the review is not really informative, but it has everything a good tower defense game should have. Recommend this game for sure!
One of the best tower defense games I've ever played! And I've played a lot of them.

Do you like gemcraft? some of the mechanic are here, i love gemcraft.   Pros: Its fun, not punishing if you've put the wrong upgrade, there's a reset button, multiplier exp for each stage, a lot of stuff to upgrade. From the first 42 minute i played, i have played only 3 stages yet i repeat it until i got perfect score, it's going to be a very long journey ahead for me  Cons: Crappy graphics, at first i thought i havent set the right resolution, after checking the setting, it just very pixelated, i hope its going to be like defender quest    where the dev is very awesome to upgrade the graphic after a couple of YEARS. but the fun make it up for me.  All in all, if you can't buy a freakin skyrim because that bull ♥♥♥♥ discount got cut off for releasing the new upgrade next october or factorio that will never goes on discount ever, you can buy this game instead which an awesome game!
If you like anything remotely tower defense related don't think twice. Buy it yesterday. So fun.

Hell Yes, Normally I try to avoid TD games but this one is Awesome, Unlock Traps as you play, level them up with gems for a more powerful trap and carefully place them to maximum effect and you'll be destroying the forces of good with a smile and a glint in your eye. use the dungeons walls, pits and others things to your advantage, pick the right traps for your dungeon, otherwise you will be overwhelmed. a fun and interesting game and music is well made for the game and good to listen to.

Just played the first couple of maps. Visually not stunning, though just from a fidelity standpoint. Not a pixel-art throwback (yay), and the animation is smooth. Much blood (yay). I suspect this is a damn great little game. Looking forward to watching hordes upon hordes upon hordes of do-gooders hurl themselves into custom halls of death.

Best Tower Defense Game Ive Played. 10/10 Golden Coffee Award  Pros: Tons of levels Tons of traps Tons of towers Tons of enemies Tons of fun Tons of replayability Tons of awesome 8-bit graphics  Cons: Map editor has some glitches  Amazing game i highly recommend this

Dungeon Warfare is a work of Warfare. The superb way every Warfare forces you to calculate Warfare perfectly, the many varied Warfare with hunderds of unique Warfare, everything comes together to make what is certainly the greatest Warfare roguelike of 2016.

> gameplay 10/10 extremly satisfying and never boring > sound design 7/10 generic but fitting music and odd sounds in someplaces but has satisfying noises for traps > lots of replayability with runes acting as skulls in Halo that give you XP multiplyer and with workshop compatibilty you cant lose > Addictive gameplay that can hook you in > easy to use level designer   overall 9/10 cant go wrong
A great classical TD without any mechanics set up to explicitly screw over players.
Picked this up in the winter sale and it's a steal at five bucks. The game is easily worth full price and is a blast to play.
Pros -Highly original tower defense game. -Good game balance. -Supported by occassional patches -feels like it was made for pc  Cons -none
Very faithful to the basic game .  Various levels .  Content and a variety of difficulty.  Of course, a lot of fun . Moreover, it is cheaper Strongly recommended

It was somewhat easier to beat once I figured out the right combos of turrets. However this is still one of the more challenging and better tower defense games out there. From first map all the way to even the last map they continue to introduce a new type of enemy to fight.           YouTube™ Video:  Dungeon Warfare - Gameplay Review

A hard, challenging Tower defense game. I really enjoy this game because there is no real set path for most of the maps so trying to come up with a strategy on how to survive is always loads of fun. If you are a fan of Tower defense games, get this one! You won't regret it. And use that harpoon trap. My god that trap is OP.

The music gets old fast and the game balance is all over the place.  You can't see all the waves at the start so you can't choose an appropriate loadout for half the maps without having played through most of it already and unavoidably lost.  The traps become available as you complete maps yet unlike any other tower defense the availability is almost directly proportional to how far you are through the game. I got really tired of not having all the tools I wanted for any given map.  Also there's a lot of random chance involved in trap behavior and enemy movement. Maybe your pusher trap will catch a whole lot of enemies, or maybe it will only push one! Even if you set things up to clump up enemies the pusher will sometimes just fail to work properly or miss some of the clump. There's serious reliability issues, which makes the fast-moving enemies that ignore demons (one of the best ways to control enemy movement) MAJOR problems, even if you plan for them. You basically just have to hope that the setup you have is enough for whatever the level throws at you.  I don't like having to HOPE. I want to be able to PLAN.  Edit: okay, now you can see what all the units in each wave are by scrolling the waves. Yet that doesn't solve some of the most irritating problems with this game: MASS UNITS. The game loves to throw like 50 of one type at you, and if your setup isn't specifically made to deal with that and actually WORKS to deal with that, you're screwed. There are just too many enemy units that require specific traps to deal with, especially with runes enabled.
